oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1941-10-04 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 4, 1941. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Rachel Veach, Alcyone Bate Beasley and her trio (of Jack Shook, Napoleon 'Nap' Bastien, and Dee Simmons), Paul Warmack and his Gully Jumpers, Ford Rush, Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers, and Pap & Odie (likely Lonnie Wilson and Curly Rhodes respectively). Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rachel Veach; Alcyone Bate Beasley; Jack Shook; Napoleon 'Nap' Bastien; Dee Simmons; Paul Warmack; Gully Jumpers; Ford Rush; Mac McGar; Tennessee Mountaineers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Opening theme -- Louie Buck introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys with Rachel Veach -- Soldier's Joy (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Rachel Veach) -- George D. Hay introduces Alcyone Bate Beasley and her trio -- My Old Kentucky Home (Alcyone Bate Beasley, Jack Shook, Nap Bastien, Dee Simmons) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay, Roy Acuff, Bashful Brother Oswald) -- George D. Hay introduces Paul Warmack and his Gully Jumpers -- Eighth Of January (Paul Warmack and his Gully Jumpers) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- Maple On The Hill (Ford Rush) -- George D. Hay introduces Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers -- Fisher's Hornpipe (Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Pap & Odie; Wilson, Lonnie; Rhodes, Curly; McGar, Mac; Tennessee Mountaineers (Musical group : Mac McGar); Gully Jumpers (Paul Warmack); Warmack, Paul; Beasley, Alcyone; Shook, Jack; Bastien, Napoleon; Simmons, Dee (Musician)
